slides.title: Welcome to Geometry
slides.content:
# Introduction to Geometry

Welcome to **Geometry** - the study of shapes and space!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Basic Elements** - Points, lines, angles
- **Triangles** - Types and properties
- **Polygons** - Multi-sided shapes
- **Circles** - Curves and arcs
- **3D Shapes** - Volume and surface area

> **Fun Fact:** Geometry means "Earth measurement" in Greek!

slides.title: Points, Lines, and Planes
slides.content:
# Basic Elements

## Definitions:
- **Point:** Location, no size
- **Line:** Infinite in both directions
- **Ray:** One endpoint, infinite one direction
- **Line segment:** Two endpoints
- **Plane:** Flat surface, infinite

## Line Relationships:
| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| Parallel | Same direction, never meet |
| Perpendicular | Meet at 90 degrees |
| Intersecting | Cross at a point |

## Notation:
- Point: Capital letter (A)
- Line: Two points or lowercase (AB or l)

slides.title: Angles
slides.content:
# Angles

## Types by Measure:

| Type | Degrees |
|------|--------|
| Acute | < 90 |
| Right | = 90 |
| Obtuse | 90 < x < 180 |
| Straight | = 180 |
| Reflex | > 180 |

## Angle Pairs:
- **Complementary:** Sum = 90
- **Supplementary:** Sum = 180
- **Vertical:** Equal, formed by intersecting lines

## Measuring:
- Use protractor
- Units: degrees

slides.title: Triangles Classification
slides.content:
# Triangles

## By Sides:
| Type | Sides |
|------|-------|
| Equilateral | All equal |
| Isosceles | Two equal |
| Scalene | None equal |

## By Angles:
| Type | Angles |
|------|--------|
| Acute | All < 90 |
| Right | One = 90 |
| Obtuse | One > 90 |

## Key Facts:
- Sum of angles = 180
- Longest side opposite largest angle
- Triangle inequality

slides.title: Triangle Properties
slides.content:
# Triangle Properties

## Pythagorean Theorem:
For right triangles:
```
a^2 + b^2 = c^2
```
where c is the hypotenuse.

## Special Right Triangles:
| Angles | Sides |
|--------|-------|
| 45-45-90 | 1 : 1 : sqrt(2) |
| 30-60-90 | 1 : sqrt(3) : 2 |

## Congruence:
- SSS (Side-Side-Side)
- SAS (Side-Angle-Side)
- ASA (Angle-Side-Angle)
- AAS (Angle-Angle-Side)

slides.title: Triangle Formulas
slides.content:
# Triangle Formulas

## Area:
```
Area = (1/2) x base x height
```

## Heron's Formula:
```
Area = sqrt(s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c))
s = (a + b + c) / 2
```

## Perimeter:
```
P = a + b + c
```

## Centers:
- Centroid: Medians meet
- Incenter: Angle bisectors meet
- Circumcenter: Perpendicular bisectors
- Orthocenter: Altitudes meet

slides.title: Quadrilaterals
slides.content:
# Quadrilaterals

## Types:

| Shape | Properties |
|-------|------------|
| Square | 4 equal sides, 4 right angles |
| Rectangle | Opposite sides equal, 4 right angles |
| Rhombus | 4 equal sides |
| Parallelogram | Opposite sides parallel and equal |
| Trapezoid | Exactly one pair parallel |
| Kite | Two pairs adjacent sides equal |

## Sum of Angles:
```
(n - 2) x 180 for n-gon
Quadrilateral: 360 degrees
```

slides.title: Polygons
slides.content:
# Polygons

## Regular Polygons:
All sides and angles equal.

| Sides | Name | Interior Angle |
|-------|------|----------------|
| 3 | Triangle | 60 |
| 4 | Square | 90 |
| 5 | Pentagon | 108 |
| 6 | Hexagon | 120 |
| 8 | Octagon | 135 |

## Interior Angle Formula:
```
(n - 2) x 180 / n
```

## Exterior Angles:
Always sum to 360 degrees.

slides.title: Circles
slides.content:
# Circles

## Parts:
- **Center:** Middle point
- **Radius:** Center to edge
- **Diameter:** Edge to edge through center (d = 2r)
- **Chord:** Line segment across circle
- **Arc:** Part of circumference
- **Sector:** "Pizza slice"

## Formulas:
```
Circumference = 2 x pi x r = pi x d
Area = pi x r^2
```

## pi:
- Ratio of circumference to diameter
- Approximately 3.14159...

slides.title: Circle Theorems
slides.content:
# Circle Theorems

## Key Theorems:

| Theorem | Statement |
|---------|----------|
| Inscribed angle | Half central angle |
| Tangent | Perpendicular to radius |
| Chord | Perpendicular bisector through center |

## Arc Length:
```
Arc = (theta / 360) x 2 x pi x r
```

## Sector Area:
```
Area = (theta / 360) x pi x r^2
```

## Inscribed Shapes:
- Inscribed angle = (1/2) x central angle
- Angle in semicircle = 90

slides.title: 3D Shapes - Prisms and Cylinders
slides.content:
# Prisms and Cylinders

## Prisms:
- Two parallel, congruent bases
- Rectangular sides

```
Volume = Base Area x Height
Surface Area = 2B + Ph
```

## Cylinders:
- Circular bases

```
Volume = pi x r^2 x h
Surface Area = 2 x pi x r^2 + 2 x pi x r x h
```

## Examples:
- Rectangular prism (box)
- Triangular prism
- Cylinder (can)

slides.title: 3D Shapes - Pyramids and Cones
slides.content:
# Pyramids and Cones

## Pyramids:
- One base, triangular sides meeting at apex

```
Volume = (1/3) x Base Area x Height
```

## Cones:
- Circular base, point at top

```
Volume = (1/3) x pi x r^2 x h
Surface Area = pi x r^2 + pi x r x l
```
(l = slant height)

## Spheres:
```
Volume = (4/3) x pi x r^3
Surface Area = 4 x pi x r^2
```

slides.title: Coordinate Geometry
slides.content:
# Coordinate Geometry

## Distance Formula:
```
d = sqrt((x2-x1)^2 + (y2-y1)^2)
```

## Midpoint Formula:
```
M = ((x1+x2)/2, (y1+y2)/2)
```

## Slope:
```
m = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1)
```

## Line Equation:
```
y - y1 = m(x - x1)
```

## Circle Equation:
```
(x - h)^2 + (y - k)^2 = r^2
```
Center (h, k), radius r

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Geometry Summary

## 2D Shapes:
| Shape | Area |
|-------|------|
| Triangle | (1/2)bh |
| Rectangle | lw |
| Circle | pi*r^2 |
| Trapezoid | (1/2)(b1+b2)h |

## 3D Shapes:
| Shape | Volume |
|-------|--------|
| Prism | Bh |
| Cylinder | pi*r^2*h |
| Cone | (1/3)pi*r^2*h |
| Sphere | (4/3)pi*r^3 |

## Key Theorems:
- Pythagorean: a^2 + b^2 = c^2
- Triangle angles sum to 180

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Geometry!
